text: Hey folks. Question for those who are running backtests in the cloud, how much is it costing you? For comparison my infra is costing me about $0.50 per 1 year of backtest over pro soccer historical data. Some days I do a ton of backtests, which can add up.  I'm curious how that compares to others.

text: when you guys say backtests what does this entail?  do you have your own matching engine to simulate trades etc, or something totally different?

elements.text: when you guys say backtests what does this entail?  do you have your own matching engine to simulate trades etc, or something totally different?

text: I'm not simulating market making orders, so matching is pretty simple for my backtests. I just take liquidity, and then remove that liquidity going forward. It underestimates real world matches, but works well enough for backtesting.

elements.text: I'm not simulating market making orders, so matching is pretty simple for my backtests. I just take liquidity, and then remove that liquidity going forward. It underestimates real world matches, but works well enough for backtesting.

text: Personally I don't sweat the matching too much because it's un-knowable. In as far as I predict matching at all I just do it by using my real world data to apply a matching discount to all bets dependent on a few variables. All I really look for in historical analysis is the underlying value of the bets that are matching at any given moment. I then bet live on that basis keeping track of the potential value of the bets I'm posting and how much of that matches. I focus much more on analysing my actual bets than on historical analysis.

elements.text: Personally I don't sweat the matching too much because it's un-knowable. I then bet live on that basis keeping track of the potential value of the bets I'm posting and how much of that matches. I focus much more on analysing my actual bets than on historical analysis.

text:
<@U017FQEPV1U> Easiest way is to use Flumine MarketRecorder to gather data. Then create a strategy framework and use Flumine backtest. In theory you can change the framework to live without changing the strategy.
<https://betfairlightweight.slack.com/files/UPMUFSGCR/F013J0H5F3M/backtest_multi.py|https://betfairlightweight.slack.com/files/UPMUFSGCR/F013J0H5F3M/backtest_multi.py>
